results.firPara: The Premier Leagues chief executive, Richard Scudamore, has unequivocally insisted there will never be B teams in the Football League and that the introduction of academy sides into the EFL Trophy is not the thin end of the wedge.
results.secPara: In the wake of the decision to allow 16 invited category one academy sides to participate in the EFL Trophy, formerly the Johnstones Paint Trophy, there have been renewed fears among some fans that it could lead to B teams in the Football League itself.
results.webTitle: Top-flight B teams will never play in Football League, says Scudamore

results.firPara: Juve capitalised on a nervy first-half display by a young Spurs side who improved in the second 45 minutes thanks to the introduction of Erik Lamela, who scored
results.secPara: Spurs were dreadful at the back in the first half and not much cop going forwards either. But a young side was always going to be nervy. Lamela was streets ahead of anyone when he came on in the second half and Winks and Harrison looked the most impressive of their young players. Wanyama was solid for 90 minutes too. As for Juve, Dybala and Pjanic looked sharp and dangerous. But lets remember, it was just a warmup. Thanks for your emails. Bye.
results.webTitle: Juventus 2-1 Tottenham: International Champions Cup – as it happened

results.firPara: Pep Guardiola could take his summer spending past £100m in the coming days as the Manchester City manager closes in on Leroy Sané and the young South American forwards Gabriel Jesus and Marlos Moreno.
results.secPara: Guardiola has already bought Ilkay Gündogan for £21m, Nolito for £13.8m and Oleksandr Zinchenko for £1.7m, putting the total at £36.5m. Schalke want €50m (£41.8m) for the Germany attacking midfielder Sané, with City valuing the 20-year-old at around £5m less. Citys sporting director, Txiki Begiristain, is confident of the deal going through. If the clubs split the difference Sané would cost £39.3m, taking Guardiolas outlay to £75.8m.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola set to take Manchester City spend past £100m with triple move

results.firPara: Mamadou Sakhos Liverpool future is in doubt after he was sent home from the clubs pre-season tour of the United States by Jürgen Klopp.
results.secPara: The France international was booked on the same flight to Heathrow from San Francisco on Monday as the defender Brad Smith, who is returning to undergo a medical before a proposed £6m transfer to Bournemouth.
results.webTitle: Mamadou Sakho’s Liverpool future in doubt after he is sent home from US tour

results.firPara: The New Yorker was many things entrepreneur, art dealer and cross country runner. But he also had a vision of how football could thrive in the US
results.secPara: The New Yorker was many things entrepreneur, art dealer and cross country runner. But he also had a vision of how football could thrive in the US
results.webTitle: William Cox: the eccentric architect of professional US soccer

results.firPara: From the moment Sandra Rossi stepped on to the pitch at the Estadio Monumental for photographs with Marcelo Gallardo and the rest of her colleagues at River Plate, she was embarking on a mission that was both life-changing and game-changing.
results.secPara: Her ever-present smile was a little wider that day because a childhood dream was coming true. Rossi was not just joining one of the biggest clubs in South America but her childhood club. She was also becoming the first female assistant coach in the continents top-level football history.
results.webTitle: Sandra Rossi: the ‘brain-trainer’ helping River Plate show their emotions – and win | Juan Arango

results.firPara: Martin Glenn, the chief executive of the Football Association, has said there is a growing desire within English football for a mid-season break but it will be 2019-20 at the earliest before one can be introduced.
results.secPara: Sam Allardyce used his first day as the England manager to reiterate his belief a winter break would improve the teams lamentable tournament record. It would help the Premier League and us at international level if we could achieve that, he said. January and February is always the most difficult time to get players through. Allardyce, however, is unlikely to see the benefit during his England tenure.
results.webTitle: Winter break will not happen during current TV deal, says FA’s Martin Glenn

results.firPara: Hull City have compiled a five-man shortlist topped by Roberto Martínez as they seek a successor to Steve Bruce before the first-team squad head to Austria for a training camp next week.
results.secPara: With Bruce having resigned last Friday, Ehab Allam, the clubs vice-chairman, has taken control of the recruitment process and plans to complete the interview stage in the next few days.
results.webTitle: Roberto Martínez tops Hull City shortlist to take over from Steve Bruce
